article.title: Chinese Chess 中国象棋 - Rules & Regulations

paragraph.text:
The Chinese Chess tournament is designed to showcase contestants’ skills in this strategy board game, a talent in which a gentleman scholar in ancient China was supposed to be proficient.

Who is eligible?

The Talent Show is open to K-12 students in Washington State. Students may participate in the following divisions:

  • Division One: Grades K-5 小学组(含幼稚園)
  • Division Two: Grades 6-12 中學组


Competition Structure

Chinese Chess board and pieces are provided by the event organizer. Referees are appointed by the event organizer. The competition will be single round robin system. The general rules are:

  • The contestant that captures the opponent’s King first wins.
  • The contestant that surrounds the opponent’s pieces so that none can make any legal move wins.
  • The contestant that has 3 violations first loses. (Violation: the contestant who violates a rule and is asked by the referee to alter).
  • It is a draw when neither contestant wins, one contestant suggests a draw and the opponent agrees, or the referee declares it so.
  • It can be ruled a draw if both contestants repeat a sequence of moves that return to the same state without any violation, and both contestants refuse to change moves.
  • No "undo" in any match.

Please refer to Chapter 4, Asian Chinese Chess Rules in this link for the complete set of rules.

Awards

Awards will be given to the final three players of each division on the event day.
